legal_basis: Section 14 of the Access to Information Act
evidence_assessment: insufficient specific evidence linking probable harm to the disclosure of particular pages
significant overlap with already public information
decision_reasoning: no clear and specific evidence showing a reasonable expectation of probable harm
applicable_regulations: Section 50 of the Access to Information Act
procedure_followed: Information Commissioner investigated complaints, recommended partial disclosure
result_of_case: Court ordered the government to disclose all requested records
cause_of_action: refusal to disclose certain public opinion polls and focus group results
decision_conclusion: government did not meet its burden under Section 14
